snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry said that the United States was prepared to reach out if North Korea made the first move to abandon its nuclear weapons program.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry says that United States is prepared to reach out to Kim Jong-un of North Korea if he makes first move to abandon its nuclear weapons program; statement appears to be part of attempt by US to try to create atmosphere in which talks with North Korea might begin.

byline.contributor: Martin Fackler contributed reporting from Tokyo, and Choe Sang-hun from Seoul, South Korea.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry said that the United States was prepared to reach out if North Korea made the first move to abandon its nuclear weapons program.

headline.seo: Kerry Says Any Talks Rely on Steps by North Korea
headline.main: Kerry Says North Korea Talks Are Possible, but Hints at Conditions
headline.print_headline: Kerry Says North Korea Talks Are Possible, but Hints at Conditions
